DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Absolute Neutrophil Count Result 3 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 3 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of absolute neutrophil count in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Absolute Neutrophil Count Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for the absolute neutrophil count, the real number of white blood cells (WBCs) that are neutrophils and is derived by multiplying the WBC count times the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count; the percent of neutrophils consists of the segmented (fully mature neutrophils) + the bands (almost mature neutrophils).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The real number of white blood cells (WBCs) that are neutrophils. The ANC is derived by multiplying the WBC count times the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count; the percent of neutrophils consists of the segmented (fully mature neutrophils) + the bands (almost mature neutrophils). The normal range for the ANC is 1.5 to 8.0 (1,500 to 8,000/mm3).:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The real number of white blood cells (WBC) that are neutrophils. It is derived by multiplying the WBC count by the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count. The normal range for ANC is 1.5 to 8.0 (1,500 to 8,000/mm3).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome 3 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::3 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::3:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
